availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Eddyville, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of Alice Wake. Married to May Lyon Wake. Father of Mary L. Wake. Married to Nat Ellen Doom Wake. Resident of Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Eddyville in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 300; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 100; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 13; "Kentucky Death Records, 1911-1962," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:NSP6-LX3 : 20 October 2016), Russell Wake in entry for Hugh Wake, 1944; citing Kuttawa, Lyon, Kentucky, United States, Office of Vital Statistics, Frankfort; FHL microfilm 1,913,558; Find A Grave, "Russell Weir Wake (1834-1888)," Memorial #6567722, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=6567722 (accessed June 18, 2017).
